sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Remarks on some late sermons, and in particular on Dr. Sherlock's sermon at the Temple, Decemb. 30, 1694 in a letter to a friend. Leslie, Charles, 1650-1722.
The second edition, with additions ; together with a letter to the author of a pamphlet, entitled, A defence of the Archbishop's sermon, &c. and several other sermons, &c.
[12], 52 [i.e. 53] p.
[s.n.], London : 1695.
"A defence of the Archbishops sermon ..." has been erroneously attributed to Thomas Wagstaffe. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
Remarks on some late sermons, and in particular on Dr. Sherlock's sermon at the Temple, Decemb. 30, 1694 in a letter to a friend. Leslie, Charles, 1650-1722.
The second edition, with additions ; together with a letter to the author of a pamphlet, entitled, A defence of the Archbishop's sermon, &c. and several other sermons, &c.
[12], 52 [i.e. 53] p.
[s.n.], London : 1695.
"A defence of the Archbishops sermon ..." has been erroneously attributed to Thomas Wagstaffe. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
